_prev_prog_2.MH_OtherType: Vehicle or Projectile Strike, Vandalism, Theft, or Terrorism
_prev_prog_2.Description:
AA S&H (Covered Process 1):



The Facility Blender Operator implements the Risk Management Plan (RMP) Program (RMPr) for the RMP covered processes at this Facility and is assisted by other trained employees as directed.  The RMPr includes all Program 2 Accident Prevention Program elements: Management System, Off-site Consequence Analysis, Process Safety Information, Process Hazard Analysis, Operating Procedures, Training, Mechanical Integrity, Incident Investigation, Emergency Response, and Compliance Audits.



This Facility stores and handles a 23% ammonia concentrated solution in two (2) dedicated stationary 30,000-gallon aboveground storage tanks (AST) that are designed to operate at atmospheric pressure.  The process equipment includes the ASTs and ancillary process piping, valves, and transfer hoses.   



Trained Process Operators operate the covered process which includes the: (1) oversight of aqua ammonia transfer from the commercial tanker truck to the ASTs; and (2) storage of aqua ammonia in the AST.  These operations are conducted in accordance with the RMPr Operating Procedures.  Trained personnel perform maintenance on this covered process in accordance with the RMPr Mechanical Integrity Procedures.

_prev_prog_2.MH_OtherType: Vehicle or Projectile Strike, Vandalism, Theft, or Terrorism
_prev_prog_2.EquipmentTested: Liquid Pumps, process piping, valves, transfer hose, Mixer
_prev_prog_2.Description:
Fertilizer Blending (Covered Process 2):



The Facility Blender Operator implements the Risk Management Plan (RMP) Program (RMPr) for the RMP covered process at this Facility and is assisted by other trained employees as directed.  The RMPr includes all Program 2 Accident Prevention Program elements: Management System, Off-site Consequence Analysis, Process Safety Information, Process Hazard Analysis, Operating Procedures, Training, Mechanical Integrity, Incident Investigation, Emergency Response, and Compliance Audits.



The Facility blends the aqua ammonia with water and phosphoric acid to make a liquid intermediate Fertilizer product (i.e. 6-17-0).  The process equipment consists of: (1) one 6,250-gallon aboveground storage tank (AST) of water; (2) two 30,000-gallon ASTs of Phosphoric Acid; (3) two 30,000-gallon ASTs containing aqua ammonia; (4) a Stationary Blender; and (5) one 12,000-gallon AST for the 6-17-0 intermediate liquid fertilizer product.  The Stationary Blender ancillary equipment includes a Mix Pot, process piping, liquid pumps, control valves, pressure and temperature gauges, and a weight scale.  The Stationary Blender does not have any storage capabilities for aqua ammonia. The fertilizer products are not subject to the RMP rule.



Trained Process Operators operate the covered process which includes the: (1) transfer of water, phosphoric acid, and aqua ammonia to the Stationary Blender; (2) monitoring of flows, temperatures, pressures, and weight; and (3) transfer of the 6-17-0 intermediate product to the AST for storage.  These operations are conducted in accordance with the RMPr Operating Procedures.  Trained personnel perform maintenance on this covered process in accordance with the RMPr Mechanical Integrity Procedures.

_emerg_resp.FR_OtherRegulation: This is a non-responding facility and it coordinates its response activities with the LEPC and local Fire Department. Notification information and procedures are provided in its Contingency Plan.

_exec_summary.SummaryText:
EXECUTIVE SUMMARY



This EPA RMP was prepared in accordance with the requirements of the Clean Air Act ? 112(r), and U.S. Environmental Protection Agency (EPA) at 40 CFR ?68. The OSHA PSM and EPA Subpart D RMP standards are not applicable to the processes operated at this Facility.  The electronic RMP summarizes the policies and procedures implemented by the Facility to minimize the likelihood of an accident.  The electronic RMP also summarizes the actions that the Facility has taken to ensure that a response to a release will be implemented in a proper and timely manner.



PURPOSE FOR UPDATING RMP



Helena Agri-Enterprises, LLC (Helena) is submitting the EPA RMP as a Correction.  An incorrect Zip Code (i.e. 52494) was entered in the original EPA registration/submission.  The correct Zip Code is 44811.



FACILITY



The operations at this Facility consist of chemical storage and handling, blending, retail sale and distribution.  One chemical (i.e. aqua ammonia greater than 20% ammonia concentration) is stored and handled at quantities that exceed the regulatory threshold quantity.  Covered processes operated at this Facility include:



?    Covered Process 1: Aqua Ammonia Storage and Handling

?    Covered Process 2: Fertilizer Blending



OFF-SITE CONSEQUENCE ANALYSIS



Worst case and alternative case consequence analyses were completed for both covered processes.  A single worst case release scenario representing both covered processes was prepared because both processes are physically connected by process piping.  The worst case release scenario assumes that the largest single vessel (i.e. a 30,000-gallon aqua ammonia AST) fails and instantaneously releases all content into the secondary containment that has a total containment capacity of 48,618 gallons when considering displacement of the other ASTs within the containment.  The resulting release is evaporation at the maximum temperature.



The alternative scenario for Covered Process 1 and 2 assumes a release

of aqua ammonia due to the rupture of a transfer hose during a transfer operation.  Mitigation by engineering and administrative controls is considered in these scenarios.



ACCIDENT PREVENTION PROGRAM



The Blender Operator implements the risk management planning process at this Facility. The Blender Operator is assisted by other trained personnel as directed. The Blender Operator is responsible for ensuring that its employees are properly trained in the implementation of the Program 2 Accident Prevention Program elements as related to their responsibilities.  The accident prevention program elements addressed in the RMP program includes: Management System, Off-site Consequence Analysis, Process Safety Information, Process Hazard Analysis, Operating Procedures, Training, Mechanical Integrity, Incident Investigation, Emergency Response, and Compliance Audits.



EMERGENCY RESPONSE PROGRAM



This is a non-responding Facility. The Facility has coordinated emergency response activities with its local emergency response agency and local fire department. 



FIVE YEAR ACCIDENT HISTORY



There have been no accidents in the last five years.  



CONCLUSION



The Facility complies with the requirements of the Clean Air Act, Section 112(r). The RMP will be updated as the Facility adds, deletes, or changes processes. 



NOTE: Sections 4, 5, 6, and 7 of EPA's RMP Submit Program are not applicable to the Facility.
